* Optimization Recommendations

** High-Impact Targets

Focus on these modules for maximum startup improvement:

- *~/.config/emacs/straight/build/doom-themes/doom-tokyo-night-theme* (15.63 ms, 9.9% of total)
- *ffap* (10.60 ms, 6.7% of total)
- *transient* (8.33 ms, 5.3% of total)

** General Recommendations

- 0 modules take >50 ms. Consider lazy-loading with ~:defer~
- Use ~:hook~ to load packages only when specific modes activate
- Use ~:commands~ to autoload only when functions are called
- Consider ~:defer 0.1~ for UI packages (themes, modeline)
- Review if any packages can be replaced with lighter alternatives

* Notes

** Column Definitions

- *Module*: Package or file name
- *Type*: Either ~require~ (package) or ~load~ (file)
- *Duration (ms)*: Time spent loading this module only
- *Total (ms)*: Time including all dependencies
- *% of Total*: Percentage of total startup time

** Methodology

This report was generated from benchmark-init data collected during Emacs startup.
- Generated: 2026-01-28 at 23:41:00
- Emacs version: 30.2
- Total modules measured: 92

** Next Steps

1. Focus on the top 3-5 slowest modules
2. Add ~:defer t~ to their ~use-package~ declarations
3. Run benchmark again and compare results
4. Repeat until startup time is acceptable
